description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9mbrc","text":"This protocol outlines an optimized method for extracting total protein from plankton samples, encompassing both phytoplankton and zooplankton. The procedure involves the use of lysing matrix tubes with beads of varying sizes (0.1 mm, 1.4 mm, and 4 mm), eight homogenizing cycles, and a protein extraction buffer composed of 2% SDS, 10% glycerol, 5 mM EDTA in 100 mM Tris (pH 7). The extracted crude protein is quantified using the Pierce BCA assay, either incubation at 37°C for 20 to 2000 ug/mL or at 60°C for 5 to 200 ug/mL, using bovine serum albumin (BSA) as the standard. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2h50l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f563o","text":"To enhance accuracy, the extracted protein undergoes precipitation using a chloroform and methanol solvent mixture, followed by redissolution in re-solubilization buffer composed of 1% sarcosine in 50 mM Tris (pH 7). BCA assay is then used to quantify the precipitated protein, with BSA as the standard. The absence of glycerol and the use of sarcosine instead of SDS enable a linear detection range of 5 to 2000 µg/mL in this BCA assay at 37°C incubation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ldfe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4pu7t","text":"https://assets.thermofisher.com/TFS-Assets/LSG/manuals/MAN0011430_Pierce_BCA_Protein_Asy_UG.pdf","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":95}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"8B9973430D7811EB96FE0A58A9FEAC2A","url":"https://assets.thermofisher.com/TFS-Assets/LSG/manuals/MAN0011430_Pierce_BCA_Protein_Asy_UG.pdf"}}}}
